result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheri L Meade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft-Intent. Take >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent.
Undergo a mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

Criminal Thinking Class.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the Kohl's listed in the Criminal Complaint.  
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sheri L Meade in court with attorney Mark A. Kent.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.


Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  18 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Criminal Thinking Class.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with:  Kohl's listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
45  Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
 STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.   


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
